Description: Pale brown siltware pottery jar with a rounded base. The sides narrow to the rim, below which there is a raised ridge. Much of the surface has flaked off through salt action, but traces on the base suggest that the original surface may have been cream in colour. The edges of the rim are damaged.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66 § 61, pl.xxxvi, 96)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.93, p.104, p.192, pl.34)
